intro: Dalechampia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide range of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, typically in humid environments with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
